security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill (SKILL.md) containing no executable code. The file is a markdown guide describing how to use claude-flow CLI commands for performance analysis. No file system access, network calls, or code execution capabilities exist within this skill.

content.user_title: Analyze Performance Bottlenecks in Claude Flow Swarms
content.value_statement: Performance issues in multi-agent swarms can slow down development and waste resources. This skill detects bottlenecks in communication, processing, memory, and network, then provides clear optimization recommendations with expected improvement metrics.
actual_capabilities: Detect performance bottlenecks across communication, processing, memory, and network layers
Generate comprehensive performance reports in JSON, HTML, or markdown formats
Analyze swarm operations with configurable time ranges and severity thresholds
Receive AI-powered optimization recommendations with expected improvement percentages
Compare current performance against previous swarm configurations
Apply automatic optimizations with --fix flag for common bottleneck issues
limitations: Requires claude-flow CLI tool to be installed and accessible
Cannot analyze performance of external services outside the swarm
Automatic fixes apply only to configurable swarm settings
Historical analysis limited to available metric storage

best_practices: Run bottleneck detection after major changes to catch regressions early
Start with default threshold (20%) and adjust based on environment requirements
Review automatic fixes before applying them in production environments
anti_patterns: Running analysis only when performance problems become severe
Applying --fix without reviewing the recommended changes
Ignoring warning-level bottlenecks that compound over time

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: The skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It requires the claude-flow CLI tool version 0.5.0 or later.

faq.question: What time ranges can I analyze?
faq.answer: You can analyze performance data for 1 hour, 24 hours, 7 days, 30 days, or all available history using the --time-range option.

faq.question: How do I integrate with CI/CD?
faq.answer: Use JSON output format and export to files. The example workflow in the skill shows how to run bottleneck detection and upload reports as artifacts.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The skill only reads local performance metrics from the claude-flow tool. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why are my tasks running slow?
faq.answer: Run bottleneck detection to identify if the issue is communication delays, memory access patterns, or resource contention. The report will show the root cause.

faq.question: How is this different from token optimization?
faq.description: Performance analysis focuses on execution time and resource usage. Token optimization focuses on reducing input/output tokens. They complement each other.
